title: Cryptocurrency
summary: Cryptocurrency is a digital asset designed for peer-to-peer electronic transactions, utilizing cryptographic methods to secure transfers and regulate issuance without centralized intermediaries. Bitcoin, created in 2008 by the pseudonymous Satoshi Nakamoto, pioneered this approach by solving the double-spending problem through distributed consensus. The technology enables borderless, censorship-resistant value transfer, challenging traditional financial systems.

factual.claim: Bitcoin has a fixed supply cap of 21 million coins
Global cryptocurrency ownership stood at 9.9% in 2025, equating to 559 million users
Bitcoin's annual electricity usage is estimated at 173 terawatt-hours (TWh)

interpretive.statement: Cryptocurrencies embody first-principles advancements in distributed verification, though empirical outcomes reveal high failure rates
Decentralization is 'illusory', with emerging centralization risks in mining and exchanges
Cryptocurrencies offer potential for financial inclusion, but technological and access barriers limit broad adoption
